page.title: 11Farming
page.content: Quite a lot of land north of the main A12 road on our D_Block is owned by Lord Rayleigh's Farm. However that is just a tiny piece of land which they own in Essex and west Suffolk. They grow mainly wheat and barley they also grow potatoes, rape and sugarbeat. Some fields are left as grass which is cut for silage. They have 2400 cows and they also own a dairy by Hatfield Peverel station. It was originally sited here so that there was an easy access to customers down the line, however the railway line is no longer an important means of transport for the milk. Lord Rayleigh's Dairy processes the milk quickly so that the milk got from the cows on a Thursday should reach the customers door by Saturday. The cows go to be milked twice a day, and they give up to 8,000 gallons of milk a day, though this
